[[UMTS]]/[[GSM]]/[[EDGE]]/[[HSDPA]] || BB5.0 || Candybar || 3.2 MP + VGA |} The 5210 features rubber Xpress-On shells, [[Wireless Application Protocol|WAP]] over [[Circuit Switched Data|CSD]] and a built in thermometer. The thermometer is actually the internal temperature of the phone's battery, this feature is also present on other phones that have "[[netmonitor]]" enabled. The 5210 is nicknamed a "builder's phone" because of its rubber splash/impact proof casing. Its successor is the 5100 and after that, the 5140 and 5140i. The 5510 was Nokia's first phone with a built in [[MP3]] player, and it had 64 megabytes of memory for storing MP3s. It also had a full QWERTY keyboard and an 84 Ã 48 monochrome display. This phone did not sell very well even though it was advertised on [[television]], possibly because it was too expensive and too big. Its replacement is the [[Nokia 3300]]. The 5330 XpressMusic was discontinued, but replaced by the [[Nokia X3-00]]. The X3-00 features some styling cues taken from the 5330. ====Nokia 6000 series â Classic Business series==== {{Main|Nokia 6000 series}} The Nokia 6000 series is Nokia's largest family of phones. It consists mostly of mid-range to high-end phones containing a high amount of features. The 6000 series is notable for their conservative, unisex designs, which make them popular among business users.{{Citation needed|date=June 2008}} {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Phone model !! Nokia 6131 NFC is the first mobile phone to include [[Near Field Communication]]. ====Nokia 7000 series â Fashion and Experimental series==== The Nokia 7000 series is a family of Nokia phones with two uses. Most phones in the 7000 series are targeted towards fashion-conscious users, particularly towards women. Some phones in this family also test new features. The 7000 series are considered to be a more consumer-oriented family of phones when contrasted to the business-oriented 6000 series. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Phone model !! || 2.0 |- | [[Nokia 7900 Crystal Prism]] || 240 Ã 320 || Color || 24 || 2008 || D || [[GSM]] || || Candybar || 2.0 |} The 7110 was the first Nokia phone with a [[Wireless Application Protocol|WAP]] browser. WAP was significantly hyped up during the 1998â2000 Internet boom. However WAP did not meet these expectations and uptake was limited. Another industry first was the flap, which slid from beneath the phone with a push from the release button. Unfortunately the cover was not too durable. The 7110 was also the only phone to feature a navi-roller key. The 7250i was a slightly improved version of the Nokia 7250. It includes [[XHTML]] and OMA Forward lock [[digital rights management]]. The phone has exactly the same design as the 7250. This phone is far more popular than the 7250 and has been made available on pre-paid packages and therefore it is very popular amongst youths in the UK and other European countries. The 7510 Supernova was a phone exclusive to [[T-Mobile USA]]. Only some newer units of this model have Wi-Fi chips with [[Unlicensed Mobile Access|UMA]]. The Wi-Fi adapter on this phone supports up to [[Wi-Fi Protected Access|WPA2]] encryption if present. This phone uses Xpress-On Covers. The 7650 was the first [[Series 60]] [[smartphone]] of Nokia. It was quite basic compared to new smartphones, it didn't have [[MultiMediaCard|MMC]] slot, but it had a camera. The 7610 was Nokia's first smartphone featuring a [[megapixel]] camera (1,152Ã864 pixels), and is targeted towards the fashion conscious individual. [[End-user]]s can also use the 7610 with [[Nokia Lifeblog]]. Other pre-installed applications include the [[Opera (web browser)|Opera]] and Kodak Photo Sharing. It is notable for its looks, having opposite corners rounded off. It comes with a 64 MB [[Multi Media Card|Reduced Size MMC]]. The main [[Central processing unit|CPU]] is an [[ARM architecture|ARM]] compatible chip (ARM4T architecture) running at 123 MHz. The 7710's 640 Ã 320 screen is a touch screen. ====Nokia 8000 series â Premium series==== This series is characterized by ergonomics and attractiveness. The internals of the phone are similar to those in different series and so on that level offer nothing particularly different, however the physical handset itself offers a level of functionality which appeals to users who focus on ergonomics. The front slide keypad covers offered a pseudo-flip that at the time Nokia were unwilling to make. Materials used increased the cost and hence exclusivity of these handsets. The only exception to the rule (there are many in different series) is the 82xx, 8310 which were very small and light handsets. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Phone model !! Screen type !! Camera |- | [[Nokia Lumia 710]] || 480x800 px 16m-color WVGA || 2011 || P || [[GSM]] [[EDGE]] || [[Windows Phone]] 7.5 (Mango) || BB5.0 || Candybar || 8.0 megapixels |- | '''[[Nokia Lumia 800]]''' || 480x800 px 16m-color WVGA [[AMOLED]] (16.7M) Color ([[Capacitive]] touchscreen) || 2011 || P || [[GSM]] [[EDGE]] [[UMTS]] [[WLAN]] || [[Windows Phone]] 7.5 (Mango) || BB5.0 || Candybar || 8.0 megapixels |} ==Services and solutions== {{Update|type=section|date=August 2009}} ===Online services=== {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * [[Ovi (Nokia)]] {{col-break}} * [[N-Gage (service)]] {{col-end}} ===Software solutions=== {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * [[Nokia PC Suite]] * [[Nokia Ovi Suite]] * Nokia Photos * [[Nokia Lifeblog]] * Intellisync Mobile Suite * [[Nokia Business Center]] {{col-break}} * [[Nokia Sensor]] * [[Gammu (software)|Gammu]] and [[Wammu]] for both Linux and MS Windowshttp://wammu.eu/ * [[Nokia Maps]] * [[Nokia Sports Tracker]] * [[Nokia Software Updater]] * [[Qt (framework)]] {{col-end}} ===Security solutions=== IP appliances run IPSO [[FreeBSD]] based [[operating system]], work with [[Check Point]]'s [[firewall (networking)|firewall]] and [[VPN]] products. [[Nokia Network Voyager]] is an SSL-secured, Web-based element management interface. {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * Nokia IP 40 * Nokia IP 130 * Nokia IP 260 * Nokia IP 265 * Nokia IP 330 * Nokia IP 350 * Nokia IP 380 {{col-break}} * Nokia IP 390 (EU Only) * Nokia IP 530 * Nokia IP 710 * Nokia IP 1220 * Nokia IP 1260 * Nokia IP 2250 * Nokia Horizon Manager {{col-end}} In 2004, Nokia began offering their own SSL VPN appliances based on IP Security Platforms and the pre-hardened Nokia IPSO operating system. Client integrity scanning and endpoint security technology was licensed from Positive Networks.{{cite web|url=http://www.tmcnet.com/usubmit/2004/oct/1083797.htm|title=Nokia Licenses Remote Access Technology from Positive Networks|accessdate=2006-11-13|publisher=TMCnet.com|year=2004|author=Business Wire}} {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * Nokia 50s * Nokia 105s {{col-break}} * [[Nokia 500s]] {{col-end}} ==Other products== ===Mini laptops=== {{Main|Nokia Booklet 3G}} On August 24, 2009, Nokia announced that they will be re-entering the PC business with a high-end [[netbook|mini laptop]] called the [[Nokia Booklet 3G]].{{cite press release|url=http://www.nokia.com/press/press-releases/showpressrelease?newsid=1336683|title=Nokia Booklet 3G brings all day mobility to the PC world|date=2009-08-24|publisher=Nokia Corporation|accessdate=2009-08-26}} ===Internet Tablets=== {{See also|Internet tablet}} Nokia's Internet Tablets were designed for wireless Internet browsing and e-mail functions and did not include phone capabilities. The Nokia N800 and N810 Internet Tablets were also marketed as part of [[Nokia Nseries|Nseries]]. See the [[List of Nokia products#Nokia Nseries â Mobile Computer series|Nseries section]]. {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * [[Nokia 770 Internet Tablet]] * [[Nokia N800|Nokia N800 Internet Tablet]] {{col-break}} * [[Nokia N810|Nokia N810 Internet Tablet]] * [[Nokia N810#Nokia N810 WiMAX Edition|Nokia N810 WiMAX Edition]] {{col-end}} The [[Nokia N900]], the successor to the N810, has phone capabilities and is not officially marketed as an Internet Tablet, but rather as an actual Nseries smartphone. ===GPS products=== {{See also|Global Positioning System}} {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * Nokia 5140 GPS Cover * Nokia wireless GPS module LD-1W * Nokia wireless GPS module LD-3W * Nokia Bluetooth GPS Module LD-4W {{col-break}} * Navigation Kit for Nokia 770 Internet Tablet, including LD-3W GPS receiver and software * Nokia 330 Navigator, that supports an external [[Traffic Message Channel|TMC]] module. * Nokia 500 Navigator {{col-end}} ===Accessories=== Nokia produces accessories to their products too many to list here. Such accessories include: * '''Carrying and styling:''' carrying cases, phone jewellery, shells * '''Car solutions:''' car kits, car phones, portable solutions, mobile holders, car accessories, car navigation * '''Headsets:''' audio adapters, bluetooth headsets, wired headsets, loopsets * '''Memory cards and cables''' * '''Music related products:''' audio adapters, music packs, music streaming, speakers * '''Navigation:''' GPS modules, navigation kits, car navigation * '''Home and office:''' desk stands, imaging, wireless digital pens, wireless keyboards, mobile TV receivers * '''Power:''' batteries, chargers, charger adapters * '''Internet Stick:''' Nokia HSPA-modem [[Nokia CS-15|CS-15]] operates in [[3G]] network, with maximum download speeds of 14.4 Mbit/s and upload speeds of 2.1 Mbit/s. ==Products marketed by Nokia Siemens Networks== [[Nokia Siemens Networks]] provides wireless and wired network infrastructure, communications and networks service platforms, as well as professional services to operators and service providers. The company is jointly owned by Nokia and [[Siemens AG]] and consolidated by Nokia.{{cite press release|url=http://www.nokia.com/A4136002?newsid=1116423|title=Nokia Siemens Networks starts operations and assumes a leading position in the communications industry|date=2007-04-02|publisher=Nokia Corporation|accessdate=2009-04-07}} ===Telephone switches=== {{See also|Telephone exchange}} {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * [[Nokia DX 200]] * Nokia DX 220 {{col-break}} * Nokia DX 220 Compact {{col-end}} ===TETRA=== {{See also|Terrestrial Trunked Radio}} Nokia sold its [[PMR]]{{dn|date=November 2011}} business to [[Cassidian]], a division of [[EADS]]. {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * Nokia THR400 * Nokia TMR400 (car model) * Nokia THR420 * Nokia THR600 {{col-break}} * Nokia THR850 * Nokia THR880 * Nokia TMR880 (car model) * Nokia THR880i [http://www.nwr.nokia.com/BaseProject/Sites/NOKIA_MAIN_18022/CDA/Categories/Operators/Government/Library/_Content/_Static_Files/tetra_touch_03_2004_gov.pdf (external link)] {{col-end}} ==Products marketed by Vertu, Nokia's luxury phones brand== [[Vertu (company)|Vertu]] is an independent company, owned by Nokia, that manufactures exclusively hand crafted high-end mobile phones. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Phone model !! Screen type !! Released !! S. !! Technology !! Generation !! Form factor |- | Signature || 116 Ã 148 12-bit (4096) Color || 2002 || || [[GSM]] || Unknown || Candybar |- | Diamond || ? || [[?]] || || [[?]] || Unknown || Candybar |- | Ascent || 116 Ã 148 12-bit (4096) Color || 2004 || || [[GSM]] || Unknown || Candybar |- | Constellation- || 116 Ã 148 12-bit (4096) Color || 2004 || || [[GSM]] || Unknown || Candybar |- | Signature S Design || Unknown || 2008 || || [[GSM]]|[[UMTS]]|[[Wireless LAN|WLAN]] || Unknown || Candybar |} Materials used include [[platinum]], 18 [[Carat (purity)|carat]] [[white gold]], 18 carat [[yellow]] [[gold]], [[stainless steel]], [[ruby]] [[keypad]] [[Bearing (mechanical)|bearings]], and a [[Sapphire glass|sapphire]] crystal display for the "Signature" and [[leather]], 316L [[Surgical stainless steel]] and [[Liquidmetal]] for the "Ascent". ==Discontinued product lines== ===Personal computers=== In the 1980s, Nokia's personal computer division Nokia Data manufactured a series of [[personal computer]]s by the name of [[MikroMikko]]. Nokia's PC division was sold to the British computer company [[International Computers Limited|ICL]] in 1991, which later became part of [[Fujitsu]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fujitsu.com/fi/about/history/1991/|title=Historia: 1991â1999|publisher=Fujitsu Services Oy, Finland|language=Finnish|accessdate=2010-09-22}} Nokia re-entered the PC market in 2009 with the introduction of the [[Nokia Booklet 3G]] mini laptop. ===Computer displays=== Nokia was also known for producing very high quality [[Cathode ray tube|CRT]] and early [[Thin film transistor liquid crystal display|TFT LCD]] Multigraph displays for PC and larger systems application. The Nokia Display Products' branded business was sold to [[ViewSonic]] in 2000.{{cite press release|url=http://press.nokia.com/PR/200001/775025_5.html|title=ViewSonic Corporation Acquires Nokia Display Products' Branded Business|date=2000-01-17|publisher=Nokia Corporation|accessdate=2009-03-22}} ===Digital television=== {{See also|Digital television}} Nokia used to manufacture digital [[set-top box]]es. {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * Nokia DBox * Nokia [[DBox2]] * Nokia Mediamaster 9500 S * Nokia Mediamaster 9500 C * Nokia Mediamaster 9600 S * Nokia Mediamaster 9600 C * Nokia Mediamaster 9610 S * Nokia Mediamaster 9800 S * Nokia Mediamaster 9850 T {{col-break}} * Nokia Mediamaster 9900 S * Nokia Mediamaster 110 T * Nokia Mediamaster 210 T * Nokia Mediamaster 221 T * Nokia Mediamaster 230 T * Nokia Mediamaster 260 T * Nokia Mediamaster 260 C * Nokia Mediamaster 310 T {{col-end}} ===ADSL modems=== {{See also|Asymmetric Digital Subscriber Line}} {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * Nokia M10 * Nokia M11 * [[Nokia M1122]] * [[Nokia MW1122]] {{col-break}} * Nokia M5112 * Nokia M5122 * Nokia Ni200http://dsl.nokia.co.nz/ni200/index.htm * Nokia Ni500http://dsl.nokia.co.nz/ni500/index.htm {{col-end}} ===WLAN products=== {{See also|Wireless LAN}} {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * Nokia A020 [[WLAN access point]] * Nokia A021 WLAN access point/router * Nokia A032 WLAN access pointhttp://www.europe.nokia.com/nokia/0,,2375,00.html * Nokia C020 [[PC card]] [[IEEE 802.11]] 2 Mbit/s, [[Direct-sequence spread spectrum|DSSS]] (produced by [[Samsung]]) * Nokia C021 PC card, with external antenna {{col-break}} * Nokia C110 PC card [[IEEE 802.11b]] 11 Mbit/s * Nokia C111 PC card, with external antennas * [[Nokia MW1122]] ADSL modem with wireless interface * Nokia D211 WLAN/[[GPRS]] PC card {{col-end}} ===Military communications and equipment=== Nokia has developed the SanomalaitejÃ¤rjestelmÃ¤ ("Message device system") for the [[Finnish Defence Forces]].
